newsitem.title: USA: Republic Industries to take $120 million charges.
newsitem.headline: Republic Industries to take $120 million charges.

text.p: Republic Industries Inc. said Tuesday it would take charges totalling $120 million related to its acquisition of Alamo Rent- A-Car Inc., which the company bought last month for $625 million.
Republic, a diversified company led by H. Wayne Huizenga, specialises in electronic security, solid waste and cars.
It said the charges include $30 million to refinance Alamo's debt and $90 million to integrate the operations of the car rental firm.
The company announced on Monday that it would buy Ed Mullinax Inc., owner of Ford and Lincoln-Mercury dealerships in northeast Ohio and southern Florida, for $100 million.
Republic's stock was up 12.5 cents at $31 in early trading on the Nasdaq market.
